QIIME

Informations

  • Version : 1.8.0
  • Licence : GPLv3 ou +
  • Page Web : http://qiime.org/
  • Description : QIIME (canonically pronounced “chime”) stands for Quantitative Insights Into Microbial Ecology. QIIME is an open source software package for comparison and analysis of microbial communities, primarily based on high-throughput amplicon sequencing data (such as SSU rRNA) generated on a variety of platforms, but also supporting analysis of other types of data (such as shotgun metagenomic data). QIIME takes users from their raw sequencing output through initial analyses such as OTU picking, taxonomic assignment, and construction of phylogenetic trees from representative sequences of OTUs, and through downstream statistical analysis, visualization, and production of publication-quality graphics. QIIME has been applied to studies based on billions of sequences from thousands of samples.

Installation

De la bouche même des développeurs : “QIIME has a lot of dependencies and can be very challenging to install.” (http://qiime.org/install/install.html).

L'option “installation manuelle” a donc été écartée. La seconde option “l'installation assistée” a aussi été abandonnée après plusieurs échecs du script qiime-delpoy. La dernière option est d'utiliser “l'image Virtualbox” mise à disposition sur le site.

Log

  • 2014.03.19 (tlc) Déploiement de la VM à la version 1.8.0
